intro: Perityle staurophylla var. homoflora, commonly known as the star-flowered perityle, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors and rocky areas. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, while its flowers are small and white or pale yellow. It plays an important ecological role by providing nectar for native pollinators.
